009package Ch08_BinaryRegions;
010
011import ij.ImagePlus;
012import ij.gui.GenericDialog;
013import ij.plugin.filter.PlugInFilter;
014import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
015import ij.process.ImageProcessor;
016import imagingbook.common.color.sets.BasicAwtColor;
017import imagingbook.common.image.Projection;
018import imagingbook.core.plugin.IjPluginName;
019
020/**
021 * <p>
022 * This ImageJ plugin demonstrates the calculation of horizontal and vertical
023 * projections from a grayscale image. See Sec. 8.7 of [1] for additional
024 * details. The input image is not assumed binary, i.e., gray values are simply
025 * added up without thresholding. This plugin only works for 8-bit grayscale
026 * images, the original image is not modified. The resulting projections are
027 * shown as separate diagrams, which either show the relative amount of white
028 * (default) or black, selectable in the user dialog:
029 * </p>
030 * <ul>
031 * <li>The <em>horizontal</em> projection diagram has the same height as the
032 * original image and user-adjustable width, with diagram bars being drawn from
033 * left to right.</li>
034 * <li>The <em>vertical</em> projection diagram has the same width as the
035 * original image and user-adjustable height, with diagram bars being drawn from
036 * top to bottom.</li>
037 * </ul>
038 * <p>
039 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An Algorithmic
040 * Introduction</em>, 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
041 * </p>
042 * 
043 * @author WB
044 * @version 2020/12/17
045 * @version 2022/09/29 revised to match book examples
046 * 
047 * @see imagingbook.common.image.Projection
048 */
049@IjPluginName("Make Projections")
050public class Make_Projections implements PlugInFilter {
051        
052        /** Size of horizontal/vertical projection bars. */
053        public static int ProjectionSize = 150;
054        
055        /** Background color for projection diagrams. */
056        public static BasicAwtColor BackgroundColor = BasicAwtColor.White;
057        
058        /** Foreground value for horizontal projection. */
059        public static BasicAwtColor PlotColorH = BasicAwtColor.Green;
060        
061        /** Foreground value for vertical projection. */
062        public static BasicAwtColor PlotColorV = BasicAwtColor.Magenta;
063        
064        /** Plot the relative amount of white (false) or black (true). */
065        public static boolean ShowAmountOfBlack = false;
066        
067        private ImagePlus im = null;
068        
069        @Override
070        public int setup(String arg, ImagePlus im) { 
071                this.im = im;
072                return DOES_8G + NO_CHANGES; 
073        }
074        
075        @Override
076        public void run(ImageProcessor ip) {
077                
078                if (!runDialog()) {
079                        return;
080                }
081                
082                String title = im.getShortTitle();
083                int M = ip.getWidth();
084                int N = ip.getHeight();
085                
086                Projection proj = new Projection(ip);
087                
088                // draw the horizontal projection diagram:
089                double[] pHor = proj.getHorizontal();   // pHor[v] = sum of pixel values in row v
090                ColorProcessor hP = new ColorProcessor(ProjectionSize, N);
091                hP.setColor(BackgroundColor.getColor());
092                hP.fill();
093                hP.setColor(PlotColorH.getColor());
094                double maxWhite = M * 255;
095                for (int v = 0; v < N; v++) {
096                        double amount = (ShowAmountOfBlack) ?
097                                        1 - pHor[v] / maxWhite :        // amount of black in line 'v'
098                                        pHor[v] / maxWhite;                     // amount of white in line 'v'
099                        int k = (int) Math.round(amount * ProjectionSize);
100                        if (k > 0) {
101                                hP.drawLine(0, v, k, v);
102                        }
103                }       
104                (new ImagePlus(title + "-horizontal-proj", hP)).show();
105                                
106                // draw the vertical projection diagram:
107                double[] pVer = proj.getVertical();             // pVer[u] = sum of pixel values in column u
108                ColorProcessor vP = new ColorProcessor(M, ProjectionSize);
109                vP.setColor(BackgroundColor.getColor()); 
110                vP.fill();
111                vP.setColor(PlotColorV.getColor());
112                maxWhite = N * 255;
113                for (int u = 0; u < M; u++) {
114                        double amount = (ShowAmountOfBlack) ?
115                                        1 - pVer[u] / maxWhite :        // amount of black in column 'u'
116                                        pVer[u] / maxWhite;                     // amount of white in column 'u'
117                        int k = (int) (amount * ProjectionSize);
118                        if (k > 0) {
119                                vP.drawLine(u, 0, u, k);
120                        }
121                }
122                (new ImagePlus(title + "-vertical-proj", vP)).show();
123        }
124
125        private boolean runDialog() {
126                GenericDialog gd = new GenericDialog(this.getClass().getSimpleName());
127                gd.addNumericField("Size of projection plots", ProjectionSize, 0);
128                gd.addCheckbox("Show amount of black", ShowAmountOfBlack);
129                gd.addEnumChoice("Horizontal plot color", PlotColorH);
130                gd.addEnumChoice("Vertical plot color", PlotColorV);
131                gd.addEnumChoice("Plot background color", BackgroundColor);
132                
133                gd.showDialog();
134                if (gd.wasCanceled())
135                        return false;
136                
137                ProjectionSize = (int) gd.getNextNumber();
138                ShowAmountOfBlack = gd.getNextBoolean();
139                PlotColorH = gd.getNextEnumChoice(BasicAwtColor.class);
140                PlotColorV = gd.getNextEnumChoice(BasicAwtColor.class);
141                BackgroundColor = gd.getNextEnumChoice(BasicAwtColor.class);
142                return true;
143        }
144}
